Goldman Sachs predicts that Brent crude, the international oil benchmark, will top </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/markets/asia/goldman-sachs-sees-brent-oil-hitting-100bbl-q3-2022-2022-01-18/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$100 a barrel</a></span><span> this year because the pandemic hasn’t hurt demand for fuel as much as expected.</span>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GAMING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/gaming-microsoft-activision-blizzard-70-billion?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Microsoft buys a new skin
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/gaming-microsoft-activision-blizzard-70-billion?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="Activision Blizzard logo above Xbox" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/cf6acec3aa82b89f1bdbc6af2a4fc9e097be3e7d-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Like all of us, Microsoft got really into gaming over the pandemic. The tech company <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2022/01/18/tech/microsoft-activision-blizzard-acquisition/index.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> yesterday that it would acquire video game giant Activision Blizzard for nearly $70 billion.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This deal warrants a gasp usually reserved for the first time you see a Six Flags coaster IRL. Activision Blizzard would be the company’s largest acquisition by far; in fact, by deal size it’s roughly equivalent to the sum of Microsoft’s five previous largest acquisitions <em>combined</em> (LinkedIn being the biggest of those, with a $26 billion price tag).</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>An Activision Blizzard takeover would also be the biggest deal in the history of gaming, easily topping Take-Two’s purchase of Zynga for $12.7 billion last week.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With the help of Activision’s impressive portfolio of titles including <em>Call of Duty,</em> <em>World of Warcraft</em>, <em>Overwatch</em>, <em>Diablo</em>, and <em>Candy Crush</em>, Microsoft will try to galvanize its monthly subscription business, Xbox Game Pass, as the “Netflix for games.”</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">But its ambitions are bigger than that</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With this deal, the company best known for its office software is lobbing a direct challenge to Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg in the race to build virtual worlds described popularly as the “metaverse.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And the key that will unlock the metaverse, Microsoft’s execs believe, is video games.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Microsoft Gaming boss Phil Spencer has </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2022/01/10/opinion/sway-kara-swisher-phil-spencer.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">argued</a></span><span> that the quickest route into the metaverse is through infrastructure that game platforms like Minecraft have already created.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>To build out its own foundation, Microsoft has spent $10+ billion since 2014 buying over a dozen game studios before going after the biggest target in Activision.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The takeover doesn’t come without baggage, or hurdles. </strong>In July, the state of California <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/22/california-sues-gaming-company-activision-blizzard?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sued</a> Activision over allegations of sexual harassment, pay inequality, and all-around “frat boy culture.” Much-criticized CEO Bobby Kotick, who allegedly <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/activision-videogames-bobby-kotick-sexual-misconduct-allegations-11637075680?mod=article_inline" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">knew</a> about at least some of the issues, is expected to step down after the deal is finalized.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Plus, Microsoft could find itself in a place it has mostly avoided of late: in the antitrust hot seat. Regulators who have scrutinized Big Tech peers like Alphabet, Meta, Apple, and Amazon could give Microsoft trouble as they look to rein in anti-competitive consolidation in the tech industry. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ For a laugh: </strong>Here’s a <a href="https://www.tiktok.com/@morningbrew/video/7054650712868916527?is_from_webapp=1&sender_device=pc&web_id7038729997783614981" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">goofy TikTok</a> about the acquisition.<em>—MM</em></p>
</div>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TELECOM
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/att-verizon-delay-5G-near-airports?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Phones and planes are fighting again <img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/pensive-face_1f614.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt="">
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/att-verizon-delay-5G-near-airports?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="An airplane running into radio airwaves" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/2f91aea90d77f23630608b1f5042cdde654d065e-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Francis Scialabba </em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Piece of advice: Download <em>The Last Duel</em> at home, <em>not</em> at the airport. Following a last-minute appeal from US transportation companies, AT&T and Verizon both agreed on Tuesday to <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2022/01/18/5g-deployment-delays-at-airports-on-cancellation-threats.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">temporarily delay</a> their deployment of 5G services near some major airports.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The announcement came one day after CEOs from major US airlines Delta, American, Southwest, and United—along with shipping companies like UPS and FedEx—sent a <a href="https://www.reuters.com/technology/exclusive-major-us-airline-ceos-urge-action-avoid-catastrophic-5g-flight-2022-01-17/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">letter</a> to the Biden administration warning that the 5G rollout would cause chaos, affecting both commercial and cargo flights.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Emirates Airlines announced Tuesday that it was suspending service to nine US cities until further notice over the rollout.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s the latest in a dispute between the industries that’s gone on longer than the Dunkin’ line at LaGuardia. The airline executives said in their letter that upon further review, proposed measures the two sides agreed to earlier this month were not sufficient to prevent interference between crucial airplane instruments and 5G’s C-band frequencies.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Friendship over:</strong> Cell carriers, who’ve spent billions on 5G tech, are not happy about the delay. In a statement, AT&T criticized both the aviation industry for not utilizing “the two years they’ve had” to plan for 5G, and the FAA for its “inability to do what nearly 40 countries have done” in safely deploying the technology.—<em>MK</em></p>
</div>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/18/omicron-wave-appears-to-have-peaked-in-some-us-states?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Live look at Omicron in the US
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>

<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/18/omicron-wave-appears-to-have-peaked-in-some-us-states?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="roller coaster " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=670 src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2022-01-18/image-32e27999ef7512810dc9002b765c1a42f14bd1c9-480x480-gif/rollercoaster.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="roller coaster " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2022-01-18/image-32e27999ef7512810dc9002b765c1a42f14bd1c9-480x480-gif/rollercoaster.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Attractions Magazine </em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The US’ Omicron wave began as we were putting up holiday decorations, and it appears to be in retreat as we take the last of them down.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">New Covid cases have peaked in US regions that were hit hardest by the highly contagious variant, like the Northeast.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In New York City, the 7-day average of daily new cases has </span><span><a href="https://www.cnn.com/world/live-news/omicron-variant-coronavirus-news-01-18-22/index.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fallen</a></span><span> to less than 20,000 from a high of almost 43,000 earlier this month.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Washington, DC, case numbers are down 20% over the last 14 days.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Still, because hospitalizations tend to lag case growth by a few weeks, health care facilities are still treating more Covid patients. The average number of Covid hospitalizations has <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/live/2022/01/18/world/omicron-covid-vaccine-tests?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew#omicron-cases-may-be-peaking-in-some-us-states-but-covid-is-overwhelming-hospitals" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">jumped 54%</a> in the last two weeks, to 157,000.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Is the endgame near?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Since Omicron wiped out Delta but appears to be less dangerous, experts have speculated that O’s dominance could lead to Covid’s endemicity, or what Dr. Fauci described as the virus being “present at a level that does not disrupt society.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Thanks to vaccines, tests, and new at-home treatments, Pfizer’s CEO Albert Bourla predicted, “We will soon be able to resume a normal life,” in an interview with French newspaper Le Figaro.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Fauci, speaking at a panel on Monday, sounded a bit less certain, saying he hopes endemicity is coming shortly, but he isn’t ruling out the emergence of another variant that can avoid people’s immunity.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Bankers are <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/goldman-sachs-sees-profit-slip-13-11642510248?mod=hp_lead_pos2" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">making bank</a>. Goldman Sachs said it raised its pay 33% last year to a total of $4.4 billion in extra compensation. JPMorgan spent an extra $3.6 billion on comp in 2021 and Citigroup shelled out an additional $2.9 billion. These raises are seriously denting bank profits, but may be necessary to retain talent in this inflationary and Great Resignation-y environment.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“The next 1,000 unicorns won’t be search engines or social media companies, they’ll be sustainable, scalable innovators–startups that help the world decarbonize and make the energy transition affordable for all consumers.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">BlackRock CEO Larry Fink, in his closely read annual letter, argued that the <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2022/01/18/larry-fink-next-1000-billion-dollar-start-ups-will-be-in-climate-tech.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">decarbonization</a> of the global economy—and not the metaverse or crypto—will create the “greatest investment opportunity of our lifetime.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>How the humble hardware store orders things, neighborhoods, and material worlds. (<a href="https://placesjournal.org/article/community-plumbing-a-history-of-the-hardware-store/?cn-reloaded=1&mc_cid=e9a045647c&mc_eid=603c2330b2&cn-reloaded=1" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Places Journal</a>)</p>
</div>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/18/daniel-radcliffe-is-weird-al-yankovic-in-roku-original-biopic?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
You're a weirdo, Harry
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/18/daniel-radcliffe-is-weird-al-yankovic-in-roku-original-biopic?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="Weird Al Yankovic (L) and Daniel Radcliffe (R) " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/6bb5cbfb2d2cc2bf904ed2e80d3acfc8686cf7e4-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Paul Natkin (L)/Getty Images and Roy Rochlin (R)/Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’ll find out how good Daniel Radcliffe’s polka face is when the <em>Harry Potter </em>actor <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2022/01/18/arts/weird-al-movie-daniel-radcliffe.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">plays</a> Weird Al Yankovic in an upcoming Roku original biopic of the singer/comedian.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday’s announcement highlights both Roku’s push into original programming and Weird Al’s weirdly enduring appeal as an artist.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Yankovic, who’s known for his song parodies like “White & Nerdy,” “I Love Rocky Road,” and “Amish Paradise,” is the biggest-selling comedy recording artist in history and has scored 5 Grammys.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>He said he was “thrilled” that Radcliffe would play him on the screen. “I have no doubt whatsoever that this is the role future generations will remember him for,” Yankvoic predicted.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Roku, meanwhile, is trying to expand beyond just serving as a platform for other streaming apps. It launched the Roku Channel in 2017 to compete with the Netflixes of the world, and <em>Weird: The Al Yankovic Story</em> will be its first original biopic.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Final fun fact/trivia: </strong>Weird Al is one of only five artists with a Top 40 hit in each of the four decades from the 1980s through the 2010s. Can you name the other four? Answer at the bottom of the newsletter.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

The tech company \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2022/01/18/tech/microsoft-activision-blizzard-acquisition/index.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e yesterday that it would acquire video game giant Activision Blizzard for nearly $70 billion.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis deal warrants a gasp usually reserved for the first time you see a Six Flags coaster IRL. Activision Blizzard would be the company’s largest acquisition by far; in fact, by deal size it’s roughly equivalent to the sum of Microsoft’s five previous largest acquisitions \u003cem\u003ecombined\u003c/em\u003e (LinkedIn being the biggest of those, with a $26 billion price tag).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAn Activision Blizzard takeover would also be the biggest deal in the history of gaming, easily topping Take-Two’s purchase of Zynga for $12.7 billion last week.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith the help of Activision’s impressive portfolio of titles including \u003cem\u003eCall of Duty,\u003c/em\u003e \u003cem\u003eWorld of Warcraft\u003c/em\u003e, \u003cem\u003eOverwatch\u003c/em\u003e, \u003cem\u003eDiablo\u003c/em\u003e, and \u003cem\u003eCandy Crush\u003c/em\u003e, Microsoft will try to galvanize its monthly subscription business, Xbox Game Pass, as the “Netflix for games.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBut its ambitions are bigger than that\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith this deal, the company best known for its office software is lobbing a direct challenge to Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg in the race to build virtual worlds described popularly as the “metaverse.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd the key that will unlock the metaverse, Microsoft’s execs believe, is video games.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eMicrosoft Gaming boss Phil Spencer has \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2022/01/10/opinion/sway-kara-swisher-phil-spencer.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eargued\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e that the quickest route into the metaverse is through infrastructure that game platforms like Minecraft have already created.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTo build out its own foundation, Microsoft has spent $10+ billion since 2014 buying over a dozen game studios before going after the biggest target in Activision.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe takeover doesn’t come without baggage, or hurdles. \u003c/strong\u003eIn July, the state of California \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/22/california-sues-gaming-company-activision-blizzard?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esued\u003c/a\u003e Activision over allegations of sexual harassment, pay inequality, and all-around “frat boy culture.” Much-criticized CEO Bobby Kotick, who allegedly \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/activision-videogames-bobby-kotick-sexual-misconduct-allegations-11637075680?mod=article_inline\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eknew\u003c/a\u003e about at least some of the issues, is expected to step down after the deal is finalized.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePlus, Microsoft could find itself in a place it has mostly avoided of late: in the antitrust hot seat. Regulators who have scrutinized Big Tech peers like Alphabet, Meta, Apple, and Amazon could give Microsoft trouble as they look to rein in anti-competitive consolidation in the tech industry. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ For a laugh: \u003c/strong\u003eHere’s a \u003ca href=\"https://www.tiktok.com/@morningbrew/video/7054650712868916527?is_from_webapp=1\u0026sender_device=pc\u0026web_id7038729997783614981\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egoofy TikTok\u003c/a\u003e about the acquisition.\u003cem\u003e—MM\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS style=\"display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePiece of advice: Download \u003cem\u003eThe Last Duel\u003c/em\u003e at home, \u003cem\u003enot\u003c/em\u003e at the airport. Following a last-minute appeal from US transportation companies, AT\u0026T and Verizon both agreed on Tuesday to \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2022/01/18/5g-deployment-delays-at-airports-on-cancellation-threats.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etemporarily delay\u003c/a\u003e their deployment of 5G services near some major airports.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe announcement came one day after CEOs from major US airlines Delta, American, Southwest, and United—along with shipping companies like UPS and FedEx—sent a \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/technology/exclusive-major-us-airline-ceos-urge-action-avoid-catastrophic-5g-flight-2022-01-17/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eletter\u003c/a\u003e to the Biden administration warning that the 5G rollout would cause chaos, affecting both commercial and cargo flights.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eEmirates Airlines announced Tuesday that it was suspending service to nine US cities until further notice over the rollout.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s the latest in a dispute between the industries that’s gone on longer than the Dunkin’ line at LaGuardia. The airline executives said in their letter that upon further review, proposed measures the two sides agreed to earlier this month were not sufficient to prevent interference between crucial airplane instruments and 5G’s C-band frequencies.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFriendship over:\u003c/strong\u003e Cell carriers, who’ve spent billions on 5G tech, are not happy about the delay. In a statement, AT\u0026T criticized both the aviation industry for not utilizing “the two years they’ve had” to plan for 5G, and the FAA for its “inability to do what nearly 40 countries have done” in safely deploying the technology.—\u003cem\u003eMK\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efallen\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to less than 20,000 from a high of almost 43,000 earlier this month.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWashington, DC, case numbers are down 20% over the last 14 days.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStill, because hospitalizations tend to lag case growth by a few weeks, health care facilities are still treating more Covid patients. The average number of Covid hospitalizations has \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/live/2022/01/18/world/omicron-covid-vaccine-tests?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew#omicron-cases-may-be-peaking-in-some-us-states-but-covid-is-overwhelming-hospitals\" style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIs the endgame near?\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSince Omicron wiped out Delta but appears to be less dangerous, experts have speculated that O’s dominance could lead to Covid’s endemicity, or what Dr. Fauci described as the virus being “present at a level that does not disrupt society.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThanks to vaccines, tests, and new at-home treatments, Pfizer’s CEO Albert Bourla predicted, “We will soon be able to resume a normal life,” in an interview with French newspaper Le Figaro.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFauci, speaking at a panel on Monday, sounded a bit less href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2022/01/18/arts/weird-al-movie-daniel-radcliffe.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eplays\u003c/a\u003e Weird Al Yankovic in an upcoming Roku original biopic of the singer/comedian.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday’s announcement highlights both Roku’s push into original programming and Weird Al’s weirdly enduring appeal as an artist.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eYankovic, who’s known for his song parodies like “White \u0026 Nerdy,” “I Love Rocky Road,” and “Amish Paradise,” is the biggest-selling comedy recording artist in history and has scored 5 Grammys.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHe said he was “thrilled” that Radcliffe would play him on the screen. “I have no doubt whatsoever that this is the role future generations will remember him for,” Yankvoic predicted.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRoku, meanwhile, is trying to expand beyond just serving as a platform for other streaming apps. It launched the Roku Channel in 2017 to compete with the Netflixes of the world, and \u003cem\u003eWeird: The Al Yankovic Story\u003c/em\u003e will be its first original biopic.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFinal fun fact/trivia: \u003c/strong\u003eWeird Al is one of only five artists with a Top 40 hit in each of the four decades from the 1980s through the 2010s. Can you name the other four?
